Sequence Information.Peptide Name: Thanatin R14A analog (synthetic AMPs, 1S=S, UCSS1a, XXA; BBL)
Sequence Information.Source: amino acid SUBSTITUTION, insects, animal-derived, natural derivatives

Literature Information.Literature: Sequence analysis: APD analysis reveals that this sequence is similar (95.24%) tothanatinK: 14%, I=C=G=P=R: 10%.Activity: active against E. coli BL21 (MIC 2 uM), P. aeruginosa ATCC 27853 (MIC 2 uM), S. enterica ATCC 14028 (MIC 4 uM), K. pneumoniae ATCC 13883 (MIC 2 uM), S. aureus ATCC 25923 (MIC 2 uM),  B. subtilis (MIC 2 uM), S. pyogenes ATCC 19615 (MIC 2 uM), E. faecalis ATCC 29212 (MIC 1 uM).
Literature Information.Author: Sinha S, Dhanabal VB, Sperandeo P, Polissi A, Bhattacharjya S. 2022
Literature Information.Reference: Biochim Biophys Acta Biomembr. 2022 Mar 1;1864(3):183839. doi: 10.1016/j.bbamem.2021.183839.PubMed
Literature Information.Title: Linking dual mode of action of host defense antimicrobial peptide thanatin: Structures, lipopolysaccharide and LptAm binding of designed analogs.
